summary: This Request for Proposal (RFP) from the U.S. General Services Administration (GSA), specifically the Office of the Chief Information Officer, seeks comprehensive IT website consolidation and support services. The core objective is to modernize, consolidate, and maintain a diverse portfolio of websites and web-based applications, ensuring they meet the evolving business needs of GSA, its customers, and stakeholders. The GSA aims to improve service delivery, reduce costs, and adhere to federal mandates and standards. The project involves operations and maintenance (O&M), development and enhancements, and new projects including integration, migration, and modernization of sites and applications. A key challenge is the transition of current platforms, particularly the Enterprise Content Application Service (ECAS II) environment. The selected vendor will be responsible for a wide range of tasks, including system operations, application maintenance, security and compliance, monitoring, configuration management, and documentation. The RFP emphasizes the use of Agile methodologies, open-source technologies, and cloud computing solutions to maximize efficiency, scalability, and cost-effectiveness. The successful bidder will need to demonstrate expertise in a variety of technologies and platforms, including Drupal, WordPress, AWS, and DevOps tools.

document_identification.title: GSA IT Website Consolidation & Support Services

issuing_organization.office: Office of the Chief Information Officer

project_scope.overview: Provide technical IT support services for a diverse portfolio of websites and web-based applications.
services_required: Creation, migration, modernization, consolidation and decommissioning of sites and applications
